titleStmt.title: Henry Dent et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8608

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: The undersigned citizens of Louisville Most respectfully ask that you will interpose Executive clemency in behalf of James H Montgomery who was at the Present term of the Jefferson Circuit Court sentenced to Two years confinement in the Penitentiary for the killing of T B Gibbs We know Montgomery to be a peaceable and quiet Citizen with a family and ask his pardon

Henry Dent
Selly Harney
Thos Stutz
Philip Judge
L B Porch
S Sachs
E. Bamberger
W Bloom

This caseOct took place at my office and I believe it to be a case in which Executive Clemency should be extended knowing all the facts as I do

Jos,, Clement Justice of the Peace Jeff Co Ky
Thos Moore.
